intro: Centaurea khuzistanica, commonly known as Khuzistan thistle, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a compact growth habit with a central stem and is often found in mountainous regions. Centaurea khuzistanica is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
